PLEASE READ THIS BEFORE BUYING

Half-Life DeathMatch:  Source is just Half-Life: DeathMatch (Not DeathMatch Classic), in the Source engine (BUT) it is broken thanks to SteamPipe.
If you really want to play it you should buy it, but if the bugs hamper it too much go online and find a NoSteam crack (Not Illegal because you already paid money for it) and it should run greatly, and with very few bugs.

Now onto my review.

Half-Life: DeathMatch Source is a very well made game. (before steampipe) I would highly recommend doing my above method to play this game for anyone looking to get back into Half-Life DeathMatch, but thinks the graphics could be better. Not many play online so I would recommend a BotMod for it.(Search it up online). The water and skies look amazing, the lighting is good, and  the guns, the models, and the testures, are decent. I have found the recoil is  different (It reminds me of going from CS 1.6 to CS:S) but besides that normal gameplay is very much the same as The GoldSrc version. Please buy the bundle that includes Half-Life:  Source, as it is also great. (This game also gives you more models for GMod 8.2-16)

Сюжет игры полностью соответствует сюжету оригинального Half-Life и повествует о происшествии в исследовательском центре «Чёрная Меза», расположенном в американском штате Нью-Мексико.

Действующий персонаж игры — молодой талантливый научный сотрудник Гордон Фримен, работающий в Лаборатории аномальных материалов. Обладая низким уровнем допуска, учёный не подозревает о том, какие опасности таит в себе предстоящая работа. Однажды утром Гордона направляют в тестовую камеру для проведения стандартного анализа кристалла. Последствия эксперимента, однако, оказываются катастрофическими.

Обыкновенный Deathmatch оригинальной Half-Life на движке Source. Не пойму, почему они сделали его как отдельную игру, нельзя было засунуть его в Half-Life: Source?
Increhiblemente bueno aunque un poco dificil para principiantes

Half Life Deathmatch Source is a multiplayer game based on Half Life Source where you fight to win in maps based around the first game. 

As stated before it's based around the first game, so you will see certain environments and use guns from the first game.

Now is this game good ? Not really, it's actually kind of bad. 

The gameplay of the first Half Life in general was very stiff and in general kind of clunky and while it was sort of tweaked for Counter Strike and Team Fortress, I felt that this was generally untouched. 

The hit detection for most of the guns is absolutely terrible. A point blank headshot from the shotgun will do little to no damage.

The community is also dying as there's not many players online, even more so than other classic multiplayer games made by Valve. 

Graphically the game looks pretty bad, but for a game for it's age I'll give it a pass.

Overall there's not much to say about this game, other that it's not worth your time or your money. It's bland and the community is dying rapidly, so just save your money and buy something else.

Pros:
+ Fun for a few games...

Cons:
- ... but loses the fun factor really fast
- Hit Detection is horrible
- Community is dead
Final Rating:
4/10

[u][b]-Quick Review-[/b][/u]
Half-Life Deathmatch: Source is an exclusively multiplayer FPS developed by Valve, and released 2006 (God I feel old)
Basically Half-Life Deathmatch: Source is where you use all the weapons from the first Half-Life game, and you play against other people. Unlike another game I played over the weekend (09/03/16) there were actually people on this game. But there's not very many people playing this game.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=757644964

[u][b]-Detailed breakdown review-[/b][/u]
[b]Story:[/b] The story is Gordan Freeman has gone batsh*t crazy and fighting against himself. Apparently once upon a time you could change skins, and there was a community for this game. But just like walking through a ghost town, all you see are the houses where people used to live. There are still PLENTY of servers to join, but no one to play with. It's always kinda sad to see this happen to a game.

[b]Gameplay:[/b] As far as I can tell, Half-Life Deathmatch: Source uses the same weapons as Half-Life. Just like Half-Life 2: Deathmatch uses pretty much the same weapons and features of Half-Life 2. The only difference is that as of now there are still people playing Half-Life 2: Deathmatch.

For those that like handholding and my sarcastic descriptions, here are the weapons you get: The almighty Crowbar, whom I informed everyone that I was a master of crowbar-fu. A pistol, which I had the accuracy of a stormtrooper... was it lag? or am I bad? The world will never know. You've got your revolver, which Chuck Norris can slam a revolving door [i](yeah, I stretched for that one.)[/i], your various assortment of SMG, shotguns, railguns, crossbow, laser tracking rocket of death, grenades, trip mines, alien gun, mining laser, and death-by-blue-vortex.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=757644974

[b]Conclusion:[/b] I feel like it's weird to see Half-Life Deathmatch: Source is priced at $9.99, while Half-Life 2: Deathmatch is priced at $4.99... I guess it's that extra 5 dollars for the retro-status. *sigh*
This game is probably a pass, I could go either way on the recommendation status of this review. Based on what I played the game does what it's supposed too, there were a few people to play against, it wasn't a bad FPS death match game ... back in it's day it was quite the popular game, chances are you'll pick up this game in a half-life bundle, and truthfully you'll have more fun just playing Half-Life offline.
But, that's my thoughts on it, thank you for taking the time to read this review!
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=757644986

Seriously though, I spent 476 hours of my life playing this game that I won't ever get back. I spent years trying to gain a reputation and trying to become the best of the community for absolutely nothing. Now I know, it isn't the game's fault, it's more alike my fault. But please, for the love of God, do not make the same mistake as I did. While it might be based on one of the best FPS Games ever made, do NOT waste your money on this game - I would only recommend buying this either for those who are interested in collecting games or want the content for Garry's Mod. Half-Life Deathmatch: Source is basically a half-as'sed port of Half-Life 1 to the Source Engine but with bugs, glitches, and a almost completely dead community. Valve broke any sort of functionality back in 2013, when they ported the game over to Source SDK 2013. Even before Valve broke the game, the game never felt right in the Source Engine. And whatever you do, do NOT listen to all the Nostalgic Fa'ggots and Half-Life Fanboys who are leaving this game positive reviews. They're only leaving good reviews just because it's a port of a classic game. Valve can literally go out in their backyard and fish out the crustiest pile of dog shieet with a plastic bag and stamp the name "Half-Life" on it, and people will still buy it because it's "Half-Life". In conclusion: buy the original Half-Life or Half-Life 2 Deathmatch instead for those who really want to experience Half-Life 1 Deathmatch or just Half-Life Deathmatch in the Source Engine.

There would be no doubt that I would get a refund if I could. But unfortunately, I can't.

[h1]Half-Life:  Deathmatch Source Review[/h1]
[b]by KTMboyz[/b]

[i]"...hmm...It's pretty fun."[/i]

To start things off, I have never played Deathmatch Classic, so this is a review for what I think of this game and not as a source port.  Half-Life:  Deathmatch Source is self-explanatory.  It's Half-Life - and its deathmatch - and its on source...  lol.  There is a reason I don't recommend it and thats's because, just like all the other Half-Life multiplayer games; they're dead.  Nobody plays them anymore!  Half-Life 2:  Deathmatch has a few more players but not much.  It's a shame, this game is fun as hell!  It's got fast-paced gameplay and intersting source maps that are Half-Life 2-ish.  Don't pick it up on your own, barely anybody plays it...  If you get it in a bundle or something, then play it, it's a blast!
